excerpt: This vegan pizza is packed with spicy Buffalo sauce and flavorful cauliflower. It's perfect for a cozy night in!

instructions.name: Pizza Crust
instructions: Mix together the flour, instant yeast, salt, and sugar in a large bowl.
Add in the olive oil and warm water, and mix until a dough forms.
Knead the dough for 5-7 minutes, until it is smooth and elastic.
Cover the dough and let it rest for 10 minutes.
Preheat your oven to 450°F (232°C).
Roll out the dough onto a lightly floured surface, and transfer it to a greased pizza pan.
Poke the dough with a fork several times to prevent air bubbles from forming.
Bake the crust in the preheated oven for 5 minutes.

instructions.name: Buffalo Cauliflower Topping
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, non-dairy milk, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, and salt.
Add the cauliflower florets to the bowl, and toss until they are fully coated in the batter.
Spread the cauliflower onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake the cauliflower in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.
In a small saucepan, melt the vegan butter and hot sauce together.
Pour the hot sauce mixture over the baked cauliflower, and use a brush to coat the florets well.
Bake the cauliflower for an additional 5 minutes, or until the sauce is fully absorbed.

instructions.name: Pizza Assembly
instructions: Remove the pizza crust from the oven.
Add the buffalo cauliflower to the pizza, spreading it evenly over the crust.
Sprinkle the vegan mozzarella cheese over the top.
Bake the pizza in the oven for an additional 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Garnish the pizza with thinly sliced green onions, and serve immediately.
